alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 6:22PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Ulster and southwestern Greene Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 621 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Margaretville, or 18 miles southeast of Delhi, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Woodland Valley Campground, Phoenicia and Mount Tremper around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Cherrytown, Rolling Meadows, Maple Hill, Glenford, Atwood, Shultis Corners, Sweet Meadows, Pacama, Brodhead and Hillside. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Greene; Western Ulster
